name: seoul
summary: Color scheme for use with the 88 color terminals (rxvt-unicode)
description:
A 88 color vim scheme intended for rxvt-unicode terminals. Will also work under xterm's 256 color mode. It uses special higlight groups for Ruby, but should function with other syntaxes as well. The name is inspired from the '88 summer olympics in Seoul, South Korea. The scheme is somewhat inspired by Justin Palmer's Vibrant Ink.

The latest version should be available at: http://redflavor.com/seoul.vim

For a it's appearance check out this screenshot:  http://redflavor.com/seoul.png
install_details:
1. Drop it into ~/.vim/colors/
2. Execute :colorscheme seoul
3. Alternatively edit ~/.vimrc and add: colorscheme seoul

versions.release_notes: Conditionals added so that 88 color mode is only enabled when supported.
